name: VANGUARD

info.flavor: Vanguard-class mechs are the impromptu name given to the massive EDF production-model Euler fleet, with each mech carefully built to-spec as a rapid-response mobile weapons platform. While the Euler can be made custom-order, Vanguard-class mechs specifically are built with firepower and mobility in mind for use within the forces of the EDF and its licensees, though its flexibility has lent it to roles such as scouts or turrets.
info.tactics: Vanguards are flexible damage dealers built to take advantage of its advanced positioning capabilities. Have them support defenders, but don't be afraid of letting them retreat to cover other artillery units. It features an on-turn-off-turn pattern where it supports or attacks each turn.

power: You know, I never really considered my past self good. I'm not sure who that past self was, but it has left me with a rather horrid self that tries each and every day to reconcile with the horrid reality of what they have done. I may have atoned for whatever sins I have committed to allow myself to be born into such a poor person, and I can only pray that I may one day repay the kindness and compassion afforded to me by those who have stayed with me all these years, and can only hope that the memory of who I was will never cloud the judgement of those whoe deem to see me as who I myself am now.

info.flavor: Bombast-class mechs are a product of trying to imitate the EDF’s tank forces using a more modern format than traditional vehicles. Bombasts are known for being threats on the battlefield, intimidating younger pilots and allowing teammates to act accordingly. The EDF itself makes vast use of Bombasts to supplement its infantry forces. Inexperienced Bombasts are a common sight among Diasporan forces who mistake the class as an artillery. It is not.
info.tactics: Bombasts are primarily melee brutes meant to obstruct and disrupt player movement. However, if the players don’t engage with it, don’t be afraid to fire the Requiem Cannon to remind players of the danger they’re ignoring.
